noun.description: A granting of land by a feudatory to an inferior to hold on the same terms as the grantor holds it from a superior; a transfer of land by a subfeu; a piece of land granted on these terms.
The practice or system of granting land by a subinfeudation; the relation or tenure established by this system.

origin: Early 18th century. From post-classical Latin subinfeudation-, subinfeudatio from sub- + infeudatio.
